page.title: 18LEISURE; THE SALPERTON AREA
page.content: This is an area of country pursuits . The village shows at once there are keen gardeners.There are footpaths but most walkers are local.Hunting is popular,the"box"lies in some of the best Cotswold Hunt country;there are followers on horseback,on foot and in cars. There is a considerable amount of shooting too,both rough shooting on the farms and more organised.Several thousand pheasants and partridges are raised in the area. Part of the land is shot over by a syndicate shooting as many as 3O days between Oct l and Jan 31.This seems almost a leisure industry rather than a pastime, with half a dozen or more guns who may be paying several hundred pounds for a day's sport. Shooting means the wood land is cared for and replanted,but there is wide use of snares and traps.
